content: I'm working on a new module which provides some new config files. All of them are being copied to config/active during module install but one. Where should I look to debug this??
Watchdog? What about copying the contents of a working config file and putting it in the non-working one? If that works, it might be the syntax. If not, might not be referenced properly...

Nothing on watchdog. I copy by hand the default config file to the config/active directory and it works. It doesn't need to be referenced in any way, does it? just found this function (config_install_default_config()) but don't know how to debug it. Cannot do a var_dump
by the way, it is a config file generated by views. Don't think it is the syntax
config_install_default_config() is called by module_enable() so you shouldn't need to call it yourself...

I'm not calling it by myself. I'm just running install. I see I can use watchdog there. It's not listing the config file as installable. BTW, it's a profile, so I'm running backdrop install, not just module install.
Ah ok, sorry. I misunderstood. Yeah, debugging install profiles is hard...

I have an install profile that includes a Views config file: https://github.com/PackWeb/pw_profile Not sure if that helps...

PackWeb/pw_profile
PackWeb's custom install profile for Backdrop CMS. - PackWeb/pw_profile
thanks @BWPanda (Peter) found the problem: I had two copies of the module's folder with different Confing files :sweat_smile:
but I managed to get a list of config files trying to copy by using watchdog within that config_install_default_config() function and find the problem
